text.section: In this section, "gas company" has the meaning stated in § 1-101 of the Public Utilities Article.

section.section: A person may not wrongfully and maliciously damage, connect, disconnect, tap, or interfere or tamper with material, equipment, or facilities of a gas company.

A person may not intentionally damage or defraud a gas company by:
bypassing a meter provided for registering the gas consumed;
willfully tampering with, damaging, or preventing the action of a meter to register gas; or
causing or procuring a meter to be damaged or altered.

text.section:
Prima facie evidence of a violation of this section by the person who would directly benefit from the use of the gas passing through the meter includes:
a device that allows the use of gas supplied by a gas company without the gas being registered on a meter provided by the gas company; and
damage or alteration to a meter so as to prevent the action of the meter.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 6 months or a fine not exceeding $250 or both.
